intro: Rothmannia schoemannii, commonly known as the red-flowered Rothmannia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its striking red, tubular flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, with opposite, ovate leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardening. Its unique floral structure and vibrant color make it a notable species in its native habitat.
